text: every year the same old question what to
do with all that leftover turkey this
year curry the idea here is to change
everything you're being carbs you're be
eating tons of meat we're gonna make a
curry that's got a lot of different
things in including a pile of greens not
so much meat and some flavors that are
probably not the flavors you were eating
on Thanksgiving we're gonna start with
this is gonna follow a very classic
so-called curry pattern some peanut oil
then some minced ginger some minced
garlic and give them about 30 seconds
then some chopped onion and that you can
give a couple minutes meanwhile let's
talk about curry curry powder is sort of
a meaningless term it means a spice
mixture of the kind of spices that you
kind of find in a lot of Indian cooking
so I'm using about a teaspoon of
coriander about a teaspoon of cumin much
less turmeric turmeric is more of a
color than a flavor really anyway and
very little cayenne call it a pinch a
big pinch maybe and a lot of black
pepper say a teaspoon at this point this
should be incredibly fragrant and if
it's not incredibly fragrant it may be
that you've been keeping those spices a
little longer than you need to when the
onions are nicely browned the spices
incredibly fragrant dump in some
Tomatoes and coconut milk
and let that cook for five or ten
minutes until the tomatoes break down
just like you would any sauce and at
that point you're shredded cubed pulled
apart whatever you got turkey white meat
dark meat
whatever and a pile of spinach all
you're doing is heating the turkey and
letting the spinach wilt which will
literally be in a matter of two or three
minutes and the result is a nice varied
we could almost say exotic green strewn
day after Thanksgiving dish
completely different from what you ate
on Thanksgiving Day
